definition: unable to make sense of what one is hearing
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(negative prefix)/not/no
to understand/to comprehend

sentences.english: I couldn't understand a single word. … You could have been singing in Norwegian.
sentences.chinese: 我一個字也聽不懂，你概略在用挪威語演唱吧。

sentences.english: Firstly, she always talks in English. We don't understanded words.
sentences.chinese: 第一，她總是用英語說話，我們根本聽不懂她說什麼。

sentences.english: Excuse me, I hear a litte ask you direct for me left or right?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我聽不懂，請您詳細指給我怎麼走好嗎？

sentences.english: The old teacher was muddling on, and nobody could follow what he was trying to say.
sentences.chinese: 這位老教師在敷衍了事，誰也聽不懂他想說什麼。

sentences.english: Although I sometimes do not understand a word you say white language.
sentences.chinese: 雖然我有時候聽不懂你說的某一句白語。

sentences.english: I could not understand the lecture on the puter given by Mr. Smith .
sentences.chinese: 我聽不懂史密斯先生作的那個關於計算機的講座。

sentences.english: He gave a answer that I could not understand, and floated on by.
sentences.chinese: 他給了一個我聽不懂的回答後，就又飄走了。

sentences.english: I haven't got a clue what you're saying.
sentences.chinese: 我一點都聽不懂你在說什麼。

sentences.english: He's been babbling since he was born, and he's still speaking gibberish.
sentences.chinese: 他從出生起就咿咿呀呀，他現在還是說些聽不懂的話。

sentences.english: He asked her what ailed her, but could not understand what she said in reply.
sentences.chinese: 他問她爲什麼難過，但是他聽不懂她回答的話。

sentences.english: Talk to me sometimes, even if I don't understand your words.
sentences.chinese: 請偶爾對我說說話，縱使我聽不懂你說的內容。

sentences.english: I could not understand the lecture on the computer given by Mr. Smith .
sentences.chinese: 我聽不懂史密斯先生作的那個觀於計算機的講座。
對不起，我聽不懂您說的。

sentences.english: But, pardon me, you cannot understand what I am saying.
sentences.chinese: 但是請原諒，你們是聽不懂我說的這些話的。

sentences.english: "you can't learn if you can't understand the teacher, "she said to Nasha.
sentences.chinese: 如果你聽不懂老師在說什麼，那你就什麼都學不到。

sentences.english: Sorry, I don't understand you, will you speak slowly?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，我聽不懂您的話，請您講慢點兒好嗎？

definition: Mandarin (common language)/Putonghua (common speech of the Chinese language)/ordinary speech
to understand (by hearing)/to catch (what sb says)
to understand (on hearing)/to catch (what is spoken)
Cantonese language
Cantonese language
Southern Min, a Sinitic language spoken in southern Fujian and surrounding areas
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word

Chinese language (Mandarin), emphasizing its national nature/Chinese as a primary or secondary school subject/Chinese in the context of the Nationalist Government/Guoyu, book of historical narrative c. 10th-5th century BC
Taiwanese/Hokklo
Hakka dialect
unpleasant to hear/coarse/vulgar/offensive/shameful
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
accent
Beijing dialect
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
